titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Gene Wyckoff, Series 36
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Gene Wyckoff, Series 36 FA375

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, Gene Wyckoff, Series 36

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for scholarly research, except where particular restrictions are noted.

RAC is unable to provide access to obsolete media and original digital media. In addition separated media may not yet have undergone stabilization procedures. When feasible, a digital surrogate may be created via special order. All applicable charges will apply. See RAC Head of Archival Services or RAC Head of Digital Programs for details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in two subseries:
Subseries 1 - "Executive Chamber" Program Files, 1961-1965 Subseries 2 - "Executive Chamber" Scripts and Related Materials, 1965-1965

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains the office files of Gene Wyckoff. They document official activities in the execution of his duties as a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration, political campaigns, and/or Rockefeller's personal activities. However, unless a document is personally signed by Nelson A. Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document personally signed by him, it should not be assumed he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that staff files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller that were never shown to him.
SCOPE AND CONTENT

This series is a nearly complete representation of "Executive Chamber," a television program written and produced by Gene Wyckoff. Topics were worked out in conjunction with Governor Nelson Rockefeller and members of his staff. The programs, broadcast in late 1964 and 1965, were designed to make clear the Governor's position on issues of importance to New York State voters.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Detailed finding aids for each series of this collection are available:

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Subseries 1 is arranged alphabetically by issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries covers a variety of issues concerning New York State. It deals with topics that were covered by the "Executive Chamber" broadcasts as well as those considered for future shows.

did.unittitle: Atomic Research and Development Authority Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Script for "Operation Sun Drum II"; Second Annual Report of the New York State Atomic Research and Development Authority; report, "Malta Test Station," New York State Atomic Research and Development Authority.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report, "The New York State Identification and Intelligence System"; background information on New York State Corrections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts of "Executive Chamber" #8, 'A Walk in the Glen,' broadcast, May 1965.

did.unittitle: "Executive Chamber" #8 - Watkins Glen - Selected Production Detail, Releases

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Background information, taping schedules, production follow-up on "Executive Chamber" #8.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report, "A Helping Hand, Seasonal Farm Labor in New York State," November 1964; January 1964 issue of "Industrial Labor."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memorandum to Wyckoff enclosing NAR remarks on financial methods.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report, "The Indian Today in New York State"; report, "Annual Report of New York State Interdepartmental Committee on Indian Affairs."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scripts, drafts, background materials, memorandum and reports, 'screen shots,' press releases on "Executive Chamber" #7, "The Troubled Mind," broadcast April 1965.

relatedmaterial.p: Nine record albums (78 rpm) were removed from this folder and are stored with the audio collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Background information on Narcotics for possible used in a future "Executive Chamber" program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Background information, production notes on scheduling of the taping of "Executive Chamber" #8.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda on production of "Executive Chamber" programs and their release to television outlets.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Fourteen caption boards for the Executive Chamber series were removed from this folder and placed in box 5.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains scripts, production notes, and selected correspondence on the majority of the "Executive Chamber" programs that were broadcast. The production notes include such information as filming schedules, ideas on images and text to include in the various broadcasts, length of scenes in terms of both time and footage, sound and music suggestions, and production costs.
